Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add UUID4 id fields to Element and StructuredPrompt classes

This commit adds unique identifier fields to both Element and 
StructuredPrompt classes to simplify JSON serialization and enable
easier tracking of parent/child relationships.

Changes:
- Added uuid import and field to dataclasses imports
- Added id field to Element dataclass with UUID4 default factory
- Added _id field to StructuredPrompt.__init__ with UUID4 generation
- Added id property to StructuredPrompt for public access

All elements (Static, StructuredInterpolation, ListInterpolation,
ImageInterpolation) now receive unique UUIDs upon construction.
Each StructuredPrompt instance also gets its own unique UUID.

This change is backward compatible and doesn''t affect existing
functionality.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(gh pr create --title "Add UUID4 id fields to Element and StructuredPrompt" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
This PR adds unique identifier fields to both `Element` and `StructuredPrompt` classes to simplify JSON serialization and enable easier tracking of parent/child relationships.

## Changes
- Added `uuid` import and `field` to dataclasses imports
- Added `id` field to `Element` dataclass with UUID4 default factory
- Added `_id` field to `StructuredPrompt.__init__` with UUID4 generation
- Added `id` property to `StructuredPrompt` for public access

## Benefits
- **Unique identification**: Every element and structured prompt now has a globally unique identifier
- **JSON serialization**: These IDs simplify parent/child relationships when serializing to JSON
- **Tracking**: The IDs make it easier to track and reference specific elements throughout the prompt tree

## Testing
Verified with test script that confirmed:
- StructuredPrompts receive unique UUID4 IDs
- All Elements (Static, StructuredInterpolation, etc.) receive unique UUID4 IDs
- Nested prompts maintain separate unique IDs
- The IDs are proper UUID4 format (36-character strings)

## Backward Compatibility
This change is backward compatible and doesn''t affect any existing functionality.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)")
